intro: Aspidium caucasicum, commonly known as the Caucasian water fern, is a species of aquatic fern native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It is characterized by its finely divided, pinnate leaves that are adapted for life in freshwater environments. The plant typically grows in slow-moving streams and lakes, where it forms dense, floating mats. Its rhizomes are submerged, anchoring the plant and facilitating nutrient absorption. Aspidium caucasicum plays a role in maintaining aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
